# Writeup
Written by playtester.

For this one, I initially thought it may be morse code. However, that turned out to not be the case, as it produced gibberish.

As there were only two options (beep and boop), I then thought of binary.

Using CyberChef to convert the beeps and boops into 0s and 1s, the resulting string looked vaguely ascii. 1s and 0s produced nonsense so 0s and 1s was what appeared to work.

It was clearly some type of Caesar Cipher, but the shifts turned out random, and I went to use ROT 13 to change the shift level and it just worked.

See [this CyberChef recipe](https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/#recipe=Find_/_Replace(%7B'option':'Regex','string':'beep%20?'%7D,'0',true,false,true,false)Find_/_Replace(%7B'option':'Regex','string':'boop%20?'%7D,'1',true,false,true,false)From_Binary('Space',8)ROT13(true,true,false,13)&).

The resulting flag was `sun{exterminate-exterminate-exterminate}`
